page.title: 03THE ROYAL CORNWALL SHOW
page.content: The{Royal Cornwall Show}is an agricultural show for the county of Cornwall.Farmers come and show their best animals and produce and see exhibitions of the latest equipment available. The show was started in{1793}but only came permanently to Wadebridge in{1960 before that it was held in a different town each year.Since it came to Wadebridge the site has been used for many other events apart from the three day Show in early June. The Showground covers 9 hectares with 4 hectares of concrete roads and 2 hectares of buildings including a house for the secretary.Show days are of great importance for the county and farmers come from the whole of Cornwall to make up the attendance of about 80,000 people.
